intro: Rubus foliosus var. laevipes, commonly known as the smooth-leaved blackberry, is a shrub native to North America. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that ripen to a deep black color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and culinary purposes.
